page.title: 01GAZETEER -GENERAL SURVEY.
page.content: Essentially rural in character, past history is one associated with mining. Viewed from the highest vantage the scene is a patchwork of small fields, hedgerows, mixed woodland and small villages. On the west boundary the R. Wear runs northward from B/Auckland to Newfield, largely peaceful/picturesque it is at this latter point that we en- counter the only real industrial site left. We shall look at how geology has had a marked affect on all this. Communities more heterogeneous than of old often work outside the area. New_ comers might not regret the demise of coal-mining but they do worry about un employment. They are also concerned re shrinking services: transport, closing schools & churches; the need for play areas for children. Attitudes, however,are favourable, few would exchange this for urban living.
